div.p: This element can be found in WRITING TTEXTUALFEATURES . It contains a phrase or full sentence or more. It applies to the characteristic manner of expression; how a particular writer says things; the reflection of a writer's attitude, manner, mood, and moral outlook and the means of expressing that manner or mood (Penguin Dictionary of Literary Terms.) This tag encloses a statement of a far more undirected and general character than the contents of the TTECHNIQUES tag. It has no mandatory or optional sub-elements or attributes.

div.codeblock: <TTONESTYLE> Margaret Catchpole writes vividly (with sometimes impenetrable spelling) and exaggerates the dangers of the new country.</TTONESTYLE> <TTONESTYLE>The style of the letters said to be written by Lady Mary Wortley Montagu and Hervey is rousing but controlled, with greater economy and forcefulness than Hervey achieves when writing alone.</TTONESTYLE> <TTONESTYLE> Eleanor Porden's poem is patriotic and somewhat martial in tone.</TTONESTYLE>
